Reviews.Title: “Quintessential Fog City”
Reviews.Author: Nvigdor
Reviews.Content: It's no accident that the Hotel Drisco is No. 2 on Trip Advisor in San Francisco. My buddy and I stayed here for one night last week on the first leg of a trip to Sonoma. I wish we could have extended our stay. He's hardly the B&B type, but even he was won over by the Drisco. Parking was a cinch. We found a spot directly across the street from the hotel and didn't have to move our rental car from 4 p.m. until 11 a.m. the next day. We were immediately greeted with hot towels after a transcontinental flight and found our room to be quite charming and comfortable. Plenty of outlets to plug in iPhones, Droids and laptops. Complimentary bottled water in the room and chocolate cookies were a nice touch. The coffee/tea service in the parlor next to the reception desk tied us over until supper. John, the general manager, and the other John and Marti were all very helpful and friendly. They seemed genuinely interested in how we enjoyed our stay. Location, location, location. We opted for the Drisco over Union Square or the Financial District because, quite frankly, those cookie-cutter hotels could be anywhere. Nothing says San Francisco like Pacific Heights, the dramatic vistas of the Palace of Fine Arts and sound of fog horns in the distance. Our friends stayed down at Fisherman's Wharf and it made me appreciate the Drisco even more. High marks for the breakfast: bagels, oatmeal, cereal, fruit salad, hard-boiled eggs, etc. I also appreciated the reminder call I received about my upcoming reservation 72 hours before my stay. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint former house..but with problems”
Reviews.Author: rpfinds
Reviews.Content: We checked in last night, very pleased with our spacious one bedroom suite...until...630am in the morning... we were woken up by footsteps from the room above. The ceiling is SO thin that we actually heard everything that the people above were saying!. Unfortunate for us, there are no more rooms available in a one bedroom. Upon our return from dinner, our room had not been turned down this evening....quite annoying.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: bosslady000
Reviews.Content: Not the most convenient location for sight seeing but if you want to be pampered without paying an outrageous fortune, this is the place to go. The rooms are ok; the suites luxurious. The accoutremonts in the bathrooms outstanding. Free European style breakfasts save having lunch and the wine and cheese every evening could supplant dinner, especially if you are going to the theatre or a concert in the evening. Most important are the staff who are extremely welcoming, remember you from one visit to the next, and are more than helpful. Parking on the street helps with the budget as well.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bajarblin1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during our two night visit to San Francisco this April. This was part of our honeymoon in the Usa' From the moment our car stopped outside to the time we left two days later, the staff looked after us wonderfully. We were greated by the porter who was very plesant and helpful and after booking in we were shown our room which was lovely. This hotel has a great character and everything is catered for. There has been so much thought put in to making our stay as enjoyable as it could be from the little things such as the branded buiscuits, water and the pillow menu to the evening cheese and wine in the dining room! All the staff were so friendly and helpful, we were given advice in relation to restaurants to go to, streets to visit and even bus numbers to use. The reception would contact the restaurant on our behalf to make the reservation. Even though there was no residents parking, this was not a problem as the staff were so helpful. Thanks very much for your part in making our honeymoon so wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The most gracious hotel”
Reviews.Author: rramoni
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels like home -- if you lived in a mansion and had a team of people around who really seemed to care for you. I've stayed in quite a few nice hotels in San Francisco and this is the best by far. The staff are friendly and caring without being obtrusive, and many of them have worked there for more than a decade! Magically, they will all suddenly know your name and will pro-actively work to make your stay as nice as possible. The breakfast in the morning and wine in the evening are fantastic. The dining room is spacious and encourages you to just sit there and enjoy. They have a free car service on weekday mornings, which can come in handy as this hotel is perched up on a hill. Bring your walking shoes! This place is NOT for you if you are looking for the sleek chic of a W or Morgans hotel, which certainly have their charms if you are in the right frame of mind. It is also not for you if you don't want to climb a hill or call a taxi. This beautiful hotel is perched up among the mansions of the Pacific Heights, so the coffee places and restaurants, while close, require some hill-descent and ascent. Keep your eye on the average temperature when booking this hotel, as it does not have air conditioning. I don't think that this is a major issue most of the time in San Francisco, though. All in all, I'd encourage you to go there: I'll certainly be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for visiting grandparents”
Reviews.Author: MJerome
Reviews.Content: My parents (79 and 80) have stayed here two times while visiting us in San Francisco. They now refuse to stay anywhere else! The staff is very friendly and accommodating, making them feel at home. They love the free breakfast, as both the food and the atmosphere are perfect for starting the day. The rooms have the charm of a classic hotel with modern amenities like flat screen TVs and DVD players. The bathrooms are functional and clean, although they could use a little modernizing. Most importantly, the location in the heart of Pacific Heights is just perfect. The Presidio is a couple blocks West and the shops of Sacramento, California, and Fillmore streets are short walks away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel Drisco”
Reviews.Author: Frumpyhousewife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 4 nights in a suite (306A) at Hotel Drisco and had a wonderful time. The neighborhood is quiet and residential, with beautiful views, and is close to shopping and restaurants. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was surprisingly large. I know that other reviews have commented on the thin walls, rattling windows, etc. Please be aware that this is an old building with lots of charm, not a new, hermetically sealed concrete box with state-of-the-art soundproofing. And the windows really open! The room did come with a white noise machine, but we didn't need to use it. We will definitely stay again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “There should be more hotels like this!”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonFritz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and wished that we would have stayed longer. After long days of touring around, it was really nice to come back to a hotel that felt this comfortable. Considering its an old hotel, its very clean, well kept, the included breakfast buffet is excellent and the location is in a safe and beautiful area. The lobby had an area where coffee/tea and water were always available, a nice touch we used both nights. The parking was free which was much better than the $48 per night we paid at another hotel a few nights later, but it does come with a bit of car juggling, if you plan on parking it for the day. The parking signs say 3 hour parking from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm, so you can park from 3:00 pm to 11:00 am the next day and the hotel will make sure to move your car during the times you could get a parking ticket, a really nice service. This hotel has a GREAT staff, you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful elegance in Pacific Heights, San Francisco.”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. It was a sheer pleasure. Although it is a small hotel, it is run very professionally, from the service to the decorating to the attention to every detail. Each evening we were treated to wine and cheese in the lobby, and it was available as we walked through, so there was never a crowd. We were able to take a short walk over to the Presidio and the walking trail along the bay to the Golden Gate Bridge. On another day we walked down the hill to the Washington/Broderick/Divisadero neighborhoods to browse in small shops, cafes and great restaurants. Overall, the price was worth it for this elegant getaway and perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, staff, amenities, value and beauty.”
Reviews.Author: mbgaa
Reviews.Content: All of the wonderful reviews on trip advisor served us well in choosing this wonderful hotel. For us, it is the perfect size, giving us personal service in an extremely well located hotel. The additional amenities are incredible, especially for a big city hotel, where often everything is added on. As promised, the on street parking was easy, safe and on the weekends, without time limits and free. The front desk staff took care of everything with such a graciousness that we look forward to our next visit. We were sorry to leave as the room was spectacular, with views of the city and every comfort attended to, especially wonderful beds. Highest recommendation for all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to spend a week in San Francisco 10/10 !!!!”
Reviews.Author: SharleneR
Reviews.Content: We booked Hotel Drisco for a week so we were based somewhere for more than a couple of days for my 50th birthday. It was fantastic, very authentic historic hotel, maintained and serviced wonderfully. We loved it. I could rave on and on but I won't. I will end with saying I had a wonderful birthday and would definitely stay there again if I could. 10/10

Reviews.Title: “wow,best hotel experience.Great Location,Staff and Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mentldentl
Reviews.Content: We're more large hotel type people.After doing some research I came up with this hotel and took a chance.turns out we won big time.The staff was excellent,everyone was as helpful as can be.The continental breakfast was a gourmet treat,and the wine and cheese in the afternoon was very nice.The room we stayed in although not large was very nice,clean and fitted with many personal touches that showed someone put some thought into every detail.The welcoming living room area with complimentary coffee and teas hit the spot.The location was an unexpected delight since it is located in a the quiet neighborhood of Pacific heights.We were delighted with this find and would strongly recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Heights Beauty”
Reviews.Author: eastsiders
Reviews.Content: Perfect boutique hotel in the middle of the residential part of the wonderful Pacific Heights neighborhood. Outstanding service, comfortable well appointed room with city vistas, great breakfast included in the reasonable price. If you don't have to be in the middle of the business district, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “In My Top 20”
Reviews.Author: LeftCoastGirl
Reviews.Content: This place was really magical; it gave us the quintessential San Francisco experience. Perched atop Pacific Heights among the beautiful mansions of this quiet neighborhood, it's a jewel of an old hotel, built in 1903 as a rooming house and impeccably renovated and maintained as a hotel. My husband and I came here with our adult daughter for a one-night visit to the City. I have to admit that my positive experience was influenced by the City View Corner Suite to which we upgraded. They offered us the upgrade when we checked in (maybe because it was the low season?) for only $75 more (which the doorman pointed out was really only a net increase of $50, since we'd have needed a rollaway in our original room which would have cost an additional $25). Anyway, we took it, and the suite plus the view of SF were so beautiful that we almost didn't want to go out and sight-see! The staff were all genuinely friendly and eager to help us. Marty at the front desk was great, as was Bob, the concierge-- what a guy. Special commendation for the mattress and sumptuous linens, the impeccably clean and well-maintained rooms, and lovely bathroom. And they offered so many little indulgences to guests -- evening wine-tasting, 24-hour coffee and tea service in the sitting room, a basket of fruit in our room on arrival, cookies with turn-down service, an ambient sound machine (not that there was much street noise to mask), a nice line of toiletries, pillow menu, etc. They even called me 3 days prior to our arrival to confirm our reservation -- a considerate gesture, since they have a 3-day advance cancellation policy. My only criticisms would be the full breakfast, which was well presented but not very good food with well-meaning but rushed and overwhelmed staff. Also, the walls seemed well insulated from sound but not the ceiling -- we could hear people walking above us pretty easily.

Reviews.Title: “More than met expectations--fantastic for business and our "little" unwind time!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: Traditionally I stay at more of the chain hotels; however, Hotel Drisco came highly recommended to me so therefore I booked two rooms for the president of our college and I. We were traveling on business and needed a place to meet with donors but also where we could unwind during our little free time. We checked in late and was greeted by the most friendly and helpful staff. The rooms were so clean and had all the modern amenities and more. The personal touches such as turn-down service, free bottled water, and more made the stay exceptional. In addition, the bedding was luxurious and wonderful. Although in a quiet neighborhood, it is easy to get in and out of by car, taxi, or by walking. In addition, our donors could find us easily and there were many places to sit and chat with them over coffee, tea, or wine! I plan to stay at Hotel Drisco the next time my family visits the city and certainly has become a favorite among my co-workers!

Reviews.Title: “low-key luxury”
Reviews.Author: jwnewyork
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenaged son and I stayed here in late February. Hotel Drisco is a civilized oasis in a great neighborhood away from the tourist bustle. The house has been restored and carefully maintained. Beds and linens are comfortable and simply luxurious, decor is traditional although rooms have wi-fi and flatscreen TVs. The breakfast and evening wine receptions are incomparable, and staff and employees treat guests like royalty incognito.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and relaxing with excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Nygiantschamps
Reviews.Content: I am very picky about hotels and I enjoy luxury hotels only. What matters to me most is cleanliness, comfort, and good service. Hard to find any of the above better than at Hotel Drisco. Crowd is a little bit older so definitely not a party hotel if that's what you are looking for. Perfect for couples who are taking a break from whatever and are just looking for a clean quite place to relax. Service is impeccable. No place to eat on site and in room dining options very limited. Need to take decent walk or drive for food unless you order delivery (also not many good options). Other than that there are no negatives. Close to golden gate bridge for quick trip to Napa too.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: wls08
Reviews.Content: An interesting building with character in Pacific Heights. Its a bit of a pain to get to if you are walking or on public transport, but otherwise worthwhile for the views and for being in an area with characterful architecture. Breakfast was good and service excellent. The rooms were a little dated, and TV impossible to control, but no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Comforts”
Reviews.Author: juana123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Drisco for 4 days on business trip. I hadn't been the hotel since I was a small child, and it is still recognizable as the neighborhood hotel it was decades ago. The location is stunning- nestled in the splendor of Pacific Heights. While there aren't views of the bay or the city from most of the hotel, a wander one block and any direction offers great vistas. There is plenty to see and do within a 10-15 minute walk - Fillmore street with Jazz clubs, cafes and restaurants and the Marina in the other direction. People who work at the hotel are lovely and helpful. In terms of the conveniences offered, wireless internet, all-day coffee, tea and snacks, wine and cheese in the evening and a very nice breakfast are all complementary. While the gym in the hotel is quite limited (treadmill, cross-trainer, some weights) there are complementary passes to a large nearby gym that I wish I had time to make use of. I highly recommend the Drisco if the quiet and calm of a residential neighborhood is your style (or you're just curious to stay somewhere other than the environs of Union Square and the financial district).

Reviews.Title: “It's all true”
Reviews.Author: StuartHLondon
Reviews.Content: Top quality location and staff, nice touches with included continental breakfast and pre dinner wine. Properly trained staff who clearly care about the impression they give ad have been working at Driso for a long time. My Queen room was a touch small but VERY comfortable bed that more thn compensated. overall very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: tleecouch
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review from my wonderful room at Hotel Drisco. My husband and I are traveling in San Francisco for business and it is our last day/night at Drisco and I wanted to make sure I captured my experience here accurately. Upon our arrival four days ago, we were greeted by a very friendly staff that helped us bring all our luggage to our room and was incredibly helpful answering our questions. When I walked into the room, I was immediately impressed by the stunning view of the city and the simple yet quaint decor of the room. It was simply perfect - I couldn't have imagined a better room, nor a more fabulous location! But I have to say, what has impressed me so much about this hotel, day in and day out, is the attention to detail and the little touches they offer their guests, such as the complimentary breakfast, which is incredible, and the complimentary wine and cheese each night, the daily delicious cookies placed in the room and just a real friendly, wanting to please, staff. Oh and as a side note, coming from NYC, I was nervous the hotel location was going to be too quiet and that I would have trouble sleeping, luckily for me, they have an awesome sound machine that has helped put me to sleep every night! I have to travel downtown every day for work, and coming back here is like a breath of fresh air. I feel as if I have been a guest at someones home for the past week and I have been very very well looked after. I am actually a bit sad that we have to check out tomorrow morning, both my husband and I have on multiple occasions referred to our hotel room here as "home" which I hope is a wonderful compliment to the staff and the managers of this incredibly special place. I very much look forward to returning back to San Fran, as this will be the only hotel I would want to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and comfortable, great service”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: I am generally wary of staying at hotels that call themselves "boutique" because this is too often a euphemism for small and run-down. The Drisco is a wonderful exception. The lobby and sitting areas downstairs are elegant and inviting, as are the rooms. I hadn't asked for a room with a view, but I could see the Bay, the Presidio, lots of interesting houses, and a little corner of the Golden Gate Bridge. Everything was just about perfect: the bed, the bathroom, the amenities, the free wireless, the breakfast, the wine and hors d'oeuvres in the evening, and especially the courteous and helpful staff. The only reason some travelers might not want to stay here is that it's quite far from San Francisco's excellent subway/light rail system. But taxis are readily available, as are inexpensive airport shuttles. And walking in Pacific Heights and surrounding areas is fun as long as you don't mind hills. After one short visit the Drisco has become one of my favorite hotels.

Reviews.Title: “An English experience with great service!”
Reviews.Author: Farhad21
Reviews.Content: Unmatched in respect, personal care, and quiet surrounding in my 23 years of travel in the US for a mid size hotel. This place used to be a boarding house for the rich and famous mistresses a hundred years ago, today it stands charming and elegant very much like an English boarding house. The staff and the guests (some of them stay for long periods) are courteous and dignified. Quiet, clean, and first class personal service. The receptionists paid extreme attention and responded on every encounter. Complimentary Breakfast also include cold meats, yougurts, and variety of jams, in a den like cozy atmosphere, tea room (24 hour complimentary tea and coffee) is marvelous. Decor is elegant and early 20th century British. Drisco is fully renovated but looks and feels old world. My room was spacious with large and luxurious bathroom. My bedroom was equipped with sound box with meditative sounds, MP3 player box, and modern audi/visual gadgets and a large flat screen TV. It had a great view of San Francisco. This is a great quiet place to rest on top of Pacific Heights. There are daily personalized (complimentary) to Union square and other locations. Disco is a go-back-to place!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Camille D
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Drisco in January for our elopement to City Hall. When we arrived, we found that the staff had upgraded our one-bedroom suite to a suite with a city view. We walked into our gorgeous room, with fresh fruit and chocolate cookies waiting for us, and saw the city view looked right at City Hall! It was perfect. Throughout our stay, the staff went above and beyond our expectations. They brought me a steamer so that I could steam my dress, brought us chocolate truffles on our wedding day, and we think they even polished the rails out front in anticipation of the wedding photos taking place. The location was ideal -- right in the middle of an upscale neighborhood. We absolutely loved the breakfast and the happy hour (all complimentary). The breakfast was a great way to start our day and head out into the city, and then we would head back to the hotel for wine in the early evening, and then head back out on the town at night. All the little touches made us feel really welcome and at home. We look forward to celebrating our anniversary here for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here....I won't be able to get in when I need to.”
Reviews.Author: Glen H
Reviews.Content: Great place. Well located away from the noise and stress of the city but surprisngly close to everything. Fishermans Wharf is an interesting walk down the hill, The Presedio is a walk away, great resturants and shops a couple of blocks the other way. Amongst some of very expensive homes it was an different exerience everyday.... and the views from every window were fanstastic. We spent 6 days in San Fran and used the Drisco as our base to discover this great city. The Drisco team were freindly and helpful, the rooms bright and clean. Highly recommended. We'll be back and a few friends have gone after us.... all the way from Oz.

Reviews.Title: “Live in elegant Pacific Heights -- for the weekend!”
Reviews.Author: CMKK
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Drisco is located in Pacific Heights -- one of the most upscale residential neighborhoods in San Francisco. It is surrounded by lovely homes and condominiums, enjoying hilltop views of city and Bay, and your stay there will make you feel like you live in that beautiful neighborhood, tucked away from the hustle and bustle of touristy Fisherman's Wharf or hectic Union Square, welcomed home every time you return to this warm, inviting atmosphere and attentive staff. My husband and I drove to the city in our own car, and were delighted to find that parking was free, easy, plentiful and safe on side streets very near or adjacent to the hotel -- certainly a rare amenity in San Francisco! (We were there for a long weekend; make sure you check the city parking rules for weekdays when you will have to move your car.) We walked to a different restaurant each evening, down Divisidero Street, enjoying some of the city's classic Victorian architecture along the way. (I think the Hotel has a courtesy car as well, but we didn't make use of it.) Favorite hotel amenities: an elegant and relaxing evening wine tasting, with hot and cold hors d'oeuvres; a generous and tasty buffet breakfast; a pillow menu to ensure the perfect night's sleep; a cozy parlor for quiet conversation over coffee and tea. We've stayed in several different hotels in several different neighborhoods of San Francisco, but no more! We've found our home-away-from-home at the Hotel Drisco.

Reviews.Title: “The personal touch”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: We loved it. We stayed there with our kids in one of the suites and really felt that we were coming 'home' every night - not to a hotel room. The staff were lovely and really nice with the kids. Pacific Heights is a great part of town. We were glad to be out of the CBD and the courtesy bus downtown made it really easy to get in when we needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: On_the_hoof_3
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay in a neighbourhood that we grew to love. I was initially concerned that I'd booked a hotel out of the thick of things, but found the neighbourhood full of great places to eat, as well as extremely beautiful and actually pretty central. In addition, there was a free car service to town every morning, and a wine tasting every evening, which was a great touch. Lovely and nice sized room, great service and very good recommendations from the front desk (thanks particularly to Claude). I booked this as a treat and felt I'd got great value for money. Hope to make it back to San Francisco and to Hotel Drisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Fantastic! Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Howard5855
Reviews.Content: Excellent and gracious staff attended to every need and made us feel pampered and special. We were traveling with another couple and we both were upgraded to suites without asking. Rooms are very comfortable and roomy. Breakfast is absolutely wonderful in quality, presentation and selection. Staff took care of every request, with ease and efficiency. Evening cocktail hour was a great time to meet other guests or sit and enjoy a very nice glass of wine. We will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, more on the business side”
Reviews.Author: neyhc
Reviews.Content: the drisco hotel is, without a doubt, a great hotel. the room is very nice, very comfortable bed and a wide range a pillows for you to choose from. there's a tasting every afternoon with local wines and nice snacks. very nice staff. wonderful breakfast. paper delivered to your door everyday is a nice touch. i'd just point out that, if you're there for sightseeing, the location may not be the best one. the hotel is located in a residential area, and there's nothing much to in the neighborhood. it's a 15-min taxi ride to the main tourist attractions, and you''ll most likely depend on taxis, unless you're willing to climb the veeeery steep road that leads to the hotel --serisously, steep even for san francisco standards. other than that, the hotel is almost perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice neighbourhood hotel”
Reviews.Author: cordiners
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel within walking/short taxi disatnce of lots of authentic neighbourhood style eateries - tapas, italian, chinese- anything you want! Great breakfasts served in the beautiful little dining room. The hotel is by no means 'central' but for us it was part of a proper San Francisco experience (lots of hills and different neighbourhoods!) and it's perfectly possible to walk all the way to the piers/centre and back from the front door (and we did). We also went to a wine tasting put on by the hotel - lovely. Helpful reception staff, lovely decor in common areas, a car that will run you downtown at certain times of the day (instead of taxi/bus/walk etc), rooms cosy - maybe the bathrooms could be updated but they were clean and perfectly adequate. Overall, very pleasant experience - would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: TadeuArc
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife used to travel for work during the year and, because of that, when we are on vacation we always prefer to stay in small hotels rather than chain ones. It was not an easy task to find a small charming hotel with a reasonable price in San Francisco! Drisco is not exactly a cheap hotel, but its location, charming and staff definitely worth the stay. The rooms are big, comfortable and well decorated. Breakfast is also a good part of the stay. But thing that conquered us was the “wine afternoon”. Every day around 5PM the hotel offers two Californian wine options with salamis, peanuts and other stuffs. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with tonnes of character in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: Elbereth_Gilthoniel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at a couple of hotels in San Francisco - Drisco was one of them. I would highly recommend it. It has loads more character than most of the other hotels in the city - it felt more like staying in someone's home. Location in Pacific Heights may be out of the way for some, but was perfect as far as I was concerned. I later stayed at an establishment just off Union Square, which was so congested it was quite unpleasant. Pacific Heights in contrast, is a lovely neighbourhood - it was such a pleasure to walk around the beautiful old houses and the shops around there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: Sparky22
Reviews.Content: This lovely hotel is situated in one of the most beautiful residential neighborhoods in San Francisco. The hotel oozes charm without being too fussy. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful. We stayed one night in a one bedroom view suite. The rooms were spacious and light and decorated in a traditional style. The bed was luxurious. The bathroom was large, but a little dated. There was no closet in the room, but an armoire in the bathroom, which was fine for a short stay. The furniture was really beautiful and spotless. We could see a bit of the bay from the window. The only downside was listening to the neighbor's TV in the morning and late at night. There is a generous cold breakfast buffet in the morning and wine and nibbles in the evening. This is an amazing neighborhood to walk around. The homes are just fabulous as are the views. The doorman told us about a gorgeous walk to and around the Presidio--what a perfect way to start the day. The only downside is there are few restaurants within walking distance and the noisy TV in the room next door.

Reviews.Title: “An intmate San Francisco gem”
Reviews.Author: onlybluestones
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel for years, since it was called the El Drisco Hotel and before that I stayed with my daughter. It has a lovely ambience with a friendly and helpful staff. The rooms can be small but if you ask for one of the back rooms on the top floor , you get a lovely room with a view. They serve wine and cheese in the afternoon and a hearty breakfast , both of which are included . We would highly recommend this hotel. It is located in Pacific Heights, away from the hustle of downtown San Francisco, but close enough to get to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Understated elegance with comfort”
Reviews.Author: amtg
Reviews.Content: Perfect on all counts: clean, comfortable, friendly service from management, bellhops, front desk, servers and housekeeping. The residential location was great for us while we visited our daughter in the Cow Hollow section) away from the bustling downtown area. Lovely, substantial continental breakfast (included) add to the value. Will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: johnumina
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and am so glad we did. What a perfect place to relax after being out and about all day. Everything about this hotel was perfect. If you want a quiet,safe, comfortable hotel with great service and polite,efficient staff, this is the place. The complementary breakfast and afternoon wine and finger food just added to the great value Hotel Drisco provides.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: lilianna s
Reviews.Content: next time we visit sf we will stay here. the location was quiet and beautiful, the staff was friendly and sincere, the breakfast was very nice. I'll send my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Service unsurpassed and a benchmark of excellence”
Reviews.Author: McCarry_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 2 nights in November and I can honestly say that in all the hotel stays over a 30 year period, we have never experienced service and hospitality that matched the Hotel Drisco. Being sceptical by nature I was suspicious of all the great reviews this hotel had received and I ‘homed in’ on the odd negative review comment and I’m pleased to say that my stay backs up the very positive reviews comments. Also, like many guests these days we’ve come to expect high standards with respect to room and facility cleanliness and I’m glad to say the hotel more than passed the test. When booking this hotel I would be careful to be realistic about expectations regarding location and what to expect in this hotel class category. We had previously stayed in a 5 star Las Vegas hotel that was all new, shiny and modern and which is probably the opposite of what to you will get at the Drisco. If quiet sophistication that is backed up with a personal touch is what you’re looking for, then this hotel is for you. The hotel is set in the elegant (but hilly) Pacific Heights area and although you can walk to Union Square (as we did) my recommendation would be to get a cab it’s probably a bit beyond comfortable walking distance. As other reviews mentioned, experience the early evening wine tasting and that great healthy breakfast. I would like to give a mention to Julio, Ann and Raisa who managed these sessions, and without their attention our stay would not nearly have been so complete. Joie de Vivre Management should take note of the contributions of these individuals as they are a real asset to your organisation. Last but not least, for any budding hoteliers or managers of bed and breakfast enterprises, I would take a stay at this hotel as they provide the benchmark which you should be measured against....this hotel is real class.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: boogpowell
Reviews.Content: Smooth check-in, upgraded to a suite for my birthday celebration and complimentary chilled champagne waiting for us in our room...what more could a girl ask for? My husband and I have stayed in some pretty wonderful hotels, but Hotel Drisco strikes that special balance of being elegant and homey at the same time. We really enjoyed our interactions with Marti and Bob, and everyone we came into contact with seemed to really like being a part of this wonderful hotel. Mr. John Spear, General Manager, and all of his staff are doing a superb job, from the services/amenities sheet they provide on your nightstand to the DELICIOUS continental breakfast (even lox on Sat. and Sunday mornings!) Treat yourself to a special getaway and stay at Hotel Drisco...you will be so glad you did. I am ready to make another reservation for my next birthday!

Reviews.Title: “CGS”
Reviews.Author: cgsavory
Reviews.Content: I have traveled a great deal over the years and I must rank my recent stay at the Hotel Drisco at the very top of my hotel experiences.Everything was first class and superlative.The residential location is a true plus for many reasons.The staff was efficient,pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TaraKoehler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Drisco is one of my favorite hotels in the entire world! And I've stayed in more than 500 hotels worldwide. The service is outstanding, the rooms are quiet and beautiful, with amazing views of the San Francisco. The extras are what sets this hotel a part, with a wonderful European breakfast, evening wine/appetizers, daily newspaper, smiling maid service, happy waiters (one even made my daughter a swan out of an apple), and more. I would recommend this hotel to my best friend, parents, boss, anyone who deserves a special hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Pacific Heights!”
Reviews.Author: nana18
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Drisco hotel for 5 nights, and loved it! The hotel is located in pacific heights which is not right in the centre of SF but the location is fabulous and there is easy buses stop just nearby. The staff was so helpful ( just to name some of them Ann and Bob were so helpful and welcoming) The room was charming , the breakfast and wine reception perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl8081
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Francisco for the first time in Sept. for our 30th Anniversary. After much research on Trip Advisor, we decided to go to Hotel Drisco. It was the best decision we made. When I first booked the hotel, I was a little skeptical about not being in the “tourist area” but we were thrilled about the hotel’s location in Pacific Heights. We experienced a whole different part of the city that we otherwise would have missed had we stayed in the “tourist area”. It is absolutely beautiful in Pacific Heights and Hotel Drisco was great. When they heard it was our Anniversary, they gave us a room on the 4th floor with a wonderful view. We were greeted with a sweet note and a bottle of Champagne in our room. The breakfast every morning was fabulous, plenty of choices and a good start for our full days of touring. We only took advantage of the wine and cheese once but it was such a nice touch after a busy day of running around. Lastly, I can not go without mentioning the wonderful staff. They made us feel welcomed every time we walked in the door. They could not do enough for us. Always willing to offer recommendations and help with whatever concerns we had. Nothing was a problem to them and they made you feel comfortable. We could not say enough about this hotel. I have already recommended it to many people since I have been home, I even told someone on my plane going home about the hotel and he lives in San Francisco and plans to use the hotel when family go to visit him instead of the Wharf area. We hope to get back to Hotel Drisco real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: NatureboyRich
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the location, staff, building, and the quiet residential feel. Our room was very comfortable, with a sweet view out the window over the city. Even with the window open on the second floor there was very little noise from the street. The Breakfasts were great and parking wasn't much trouble. One night I DID have to park across the street after returning from a late dinner at Pizzaria Delfina (yum!)....it was a long walk (about 50 feet). I will recommend to any friends heading to San Francisco and will definitely stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional every time”
Reviews.Author: Suze215
Reviews.Content: Our daughter introduced us to this hotel when she lived in the neighborhood. That was 5 years ago and every time we visit our kids, we stay here. It never disappoints. This tripwe arrived around midnight and the room we requested wasn't available. The night concierge gave us a suite and they moved us the next day to a King room with an exterior view. The rooms facing the street on a high floor (3rd/4th) are the best. Avoid the street level ones (noisy) or the rooms facing the interior space which makes for a dark room. If you prefer a suite go for it--we love the King rooms with city views. The buffet breakfast every morning is included in the room price an is a real treat. They serve everything imaginable from breads, cereals, cold meats, smoked salmon, fruit, juices to butters, nutella, jams, etc. There is coffee & tea at the buffet but the waiters have a Nespresso machine in the back and will make whatever type of coffee you want. From 5 to 6:30 every night they serve wine, cheese and nuts (complimentary to hotel guests). Our favorite waiter is Julio who is a delight as well as a wealth of knowledge about the area. We look forward to seeing him every time we come. I happened to be under the weather for 2 days and went down to their living room on the main floor whilst housekeeping did our room. There you have tea and coffee available all day plus you can usually work quietly as there is a desk with pens & pads. The staff are all wonderful, there was a new woman at the front desk who was from Switzerland (une Vaudoise) who is exceptional too. All the staff is to be commended, nothing is ever too much trouble and they are ALL willing to help. Thank you! You are all terrific! We will be back, it's a wonderful home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are loud. Could not sleep”
Reviews.Author: Susankroetsch
Reviews.Content: We were woken up at 5am by stomping from the rooms above us. We returned from dinner to find turn down service did not happen. They sent in some guy who said his housekeeper went home. Very disappointing. Will never stay here ever again. Horrible. The noise factor is the pits

Reviews.Title: “Everything we'd expected, and more”
Reviews.Author: steve707
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel drisco at the beginning of september and had a wonderful time at the hotel and in San Francisco. We were made so welcome from the minute we arrived.All the staff were very helpful and friendly. The continental breakfast shouldn't be missed (especially at weekends when smoked salmon is on the menu) and it was a lovely touch to have the wine reception every evening. Our suite was super and was kept very clean. We would definitely return, and recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heidi P”
Reviews.Author: Heidi P
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to land! Really a great location within a neighborhood that offers great views, walks, architecture and restaurants. We visited with a group of friends who travel quite a bit and everyone was wowed by this place! Be sure to make time for breakfast, it is a delicious way to start the day. Don't let the separate bath arrangement keep you from staying here - it is not an inconvenience. My husband and I will be back...hopefully with more friends to enjoy Hotel Drisco!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Ashley C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Drisco and we absolutely loved it. The rooms are beautiful, clean and updated but with an old world feel. The staff is so helpful at guiding you with restaurant reservations and areas to visit. They make you feel like royalty. We especially enjoyed the wine reception and breakfast the next morning. This was our first visit to SFO and we will definitely come back and stay here again. It made our trip so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Unique in a really good way”
Reviews.Author: 406family
Reviews.Content: Everyone else has said it all, a great find, in a lovely established neighborhood, a perfect place for our group of four couples. Families and groups of girlfriends would also love this hotel as the suites allow for a number of configurations. Do not be put off by not having a bath in your room! It doesn't matter and in fact you have extra privacy. If you are addicted to air conditioning, you won't find it here, nor do all rooms have a view. Staff just terrific. Beds and linens top notch. Breakfast, included in the price (and your local friends can join you for a small fee!), is brilliant, and a good place to meet and mingle with other guests, who seemed to be from all over the world. Oh, and do not hesitate to walk down the hill and back the few blocks, even at night, to fun Fillmore Street for shops, food and services.

Reviews.Title: “The tops”
Reviews.Author: J C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fantastic. From start to finish, this is what a hotel experience should be.

Reviews.Title: “Simply terrific.”
Reviews.Author: Merricks
Reviews.Content: This is one of the world's great hotels. The location is brilliant, the service is outstanding and the suite we had was just perfect for a family of four. Children (13/11) really enjoyed this hotel. One last thing: Spend the $75 to buy the 'Hotel Drisco' dressing gown. Worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: OKAdventurer
Reviews.Content: As with all the reviews on this hotel, our stay was perfect. This hotel makes you feel as though you are at home among the multi million dollar homes it is nestled between. Sitting high atop the hill in PAcfic Heights you get great city (our room 407) views or bay views. The breakfast is diverse and fantastic. The wine reception relaxing. It's quiet, elegant, and a joy to spend our anniversary at!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: plodders
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Drisco for the start of our holiday and cannot fault it. On our arrival we were met by very friendly staff and the surprise that they had upgraded our room to a suite with a fantastic view. The Hotel is beautiful, the location is perfect, and the staff are extremely polite and helpful, We spent a lot of time choosing our Hotel and were delighted that it was everything we had hoped for and more. We cannot thank Hotel Drisco enough for making the start of our Hotel so wonderful. Book it, you will not be disapppointed! If we ever return to San Francisco we will definitely stay here :-)

Reviews.Title: “Near Perfection in the City”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted to celebrate our wedding anniversary in the City, but away from the tourists and noise, the Hotel Drisco did not disappoint. Quiet, romantic, and comfortable -- the staff, suite, location, continental breakfast, and evening wine were all excellent. We walked to Fillmore St. to shop and dine. We enjoyed a picnic lunch in Alta park while watching the Blue Angels practice. The views in Pacific Heights are to die for... and the neighborhood itself is safe and lovely. Our corner suite on the first floor was sunny and quiet with a beautiful view of the City. Our only slight complaint was that check-out was a bit slow, checking the bill was not offered (I like to double check charges and they were all fine), and no one was there to help open the heavy doors for me and get our luggage down the stairs. My husband tried to move the car to the front of the building, but someone else snuck in before us so we had to drag our luggage down the rather steep hill where he parked -- other than that slight mishap, our stay was perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location with great service and lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: TravelTrishWA
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the boutique style, personal service, so many extras from "happy hr" and 24hr teas etc., help with parking and so much more. A stylish hotel well located at the "top of the town" if you like to walk & explore and enjoy lovely streets, close to Presidio park and after staying first time at Fishermans Wharf - staying at Pacific Heights is a must.....

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdooley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here three nights at the beginning of September. We were celebrating our 30th anniversary. We couldn't have made a better choice. Helpful and cheerful staff greeted us when we check in. I had a wonderful chat with Marti as she checked us into our room. She is very knowledgeable about the " ins and outs" of the neighborhood as well as the city. You can tell by talking to her that she really loves San Francisco. Our fourth story room was clean, comfortable and had a great view the city. The staff even included a bottle of champagne waiting for us when we arrived. It was accompanied with a nice handwritten card from the manager congratulating us on our anniversary. Nice touch ! The afternoon wine tasting is a great way to meet fellow travelers. The breakfast buffet has a nice variety of items that should satisfy most tastes. My only criticism is that they didn't offer any egg choices other than hard boiled. I do like my scrambled eggs ! The hotel itself is well maintained and clean. You can see that the staff takes pride in the hotels appearance. One of the things I enjoyed was looking at all of the old photo's that hang throughout the hallways. Parking really wasn't a problem either. The hotel doesn't have it's own lot. So parking is on a "first come" basis on the street. However, I always was able to find a space within a minute or two at the most. After reading the reviews regarding this hotel I knew that it should be a good one to choose. We weren't disappointed. In fact it was even more of enjoyable stay than anticipated. Next time we come to San Francisco. This will be our choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Diane Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Drisco three times over the past 14 months visiting our toddler grandson and his parents who live very nearby. The location is not only perfect because of its proximity to our family but because it is in the quiet and beautiful Pacific Heights area. Our last stay was planned with very short notice and Marti and John Spear moved mountains to accommodate us. The friendliness and helpfulness of every single staff member, the fact that they remember us from visit to visit, and the spacious king suite with every imaginable amenity creates an elegant but homelike atmosphere. The elaborate breakfasts are the best we have ever had in hotel fare and are reminiscent of Charles Dickens’ Ghost of Christmas Present with a veritable cornucopia of choices. The dining staff always asks if we would care for a cappuccino. Our family frequently joins us for breakfast and we leave feeling relaxed, refreshed and ready to start the day. While the staff in the dining room all deserve high praise, a very special thanks goes to Raisa who lights up whenever our grandson is at breakfast and treats him like her own. What family wouldn’t like that?

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Heights Luxury”
Reviews.Author: h2onab
Reviews.Content: More like a private club than tourist hotel, you can do no better than the Drisco. Situated in the richest neighborhood overlooking the Bay, the hotel offers old-world San Francisco charm with spacious suites, excellent service and a generous breakfast. Take time to walk through Pacific Heights, the Presidio, Union and Filmore Street because you will need a car or taxi to go elsewhere. Parking is street side but be sure to keep an eye on the parking regulations. The Drisco is perfect for a romantic getaway; discreet, private and selcuded. You can do no better.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean rooms and a mattress you wish you could take home. Ask for a room with a city view.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWolf50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are from NJ and visiting San Francisco CA for the 1st time. I chose this hotel for it's up scale location, close location to restaurants and sites. It's so much worth it to spend a little more. The staff is great and Bob who first greeted us provided some very useful tips. Parking is NO problem in this area just like the hotel states. Very nice breakfast each morning, wine in the afternoon, and very clean rooms. I just wish we could have taken the mattress home. After a day of site seeing it was a pleasure to roll into bed and have great back support and wake up totally rested. I would gladly recommend this boutique hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - great service!”
Reviews.Author: austinprince
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Hotel Drisco and the service could not have been more friendly and courteous. We had a wonderful view out of our room and the breakfast is wonderful. However, I had to cut the trip short by a day and I would NEVER book such a hotel through Expedia again as they do everything they can to avoid issuing any refunds. I had informed both the hotel and Expedia in advance about cutting the stay short and after numerous phone calls, received emails from Expedia saying they had contacted the hotel and that I was not owed a refund. The hotel insisted they had never heard from Expedia regarding this and they intervened and forced Expedia to issue the refund. I would highly recommend avoiding booking through Expedia for anything if you ever want a refund as I've had difficulties with them before and after searching, found websites full of similar experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Smart friendly hotel but a bit out of the way for us.”
Reviews.Author: Callycam
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant hotel in a smart area. The room was spacious and comfortable but unfortunately we didnt have the nice view that lots of other reviewers have mentioned. We also felt it was a little too far away from the main tourist attractions which some people may prefer but as we only had 2 days in SF we would have liked to be more central. Staff were friendly and helpful and free wi fi and 24 hour tea and coffee were appreciated. A nice breakfast was included. Overall a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: shan2244
Reviews.Content: We loved it. Loved staying in Pacific Heights. The hotel has outstanding service and the breakfast is to die for. So glad we chose this charming place.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff and Management exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: wgraphics
Reviews.Content: Hotel Drisco is located at the very top of the Pacific Heights area. The views are amazing and the neighborhood is wonderful. I stayed at the Drisco a few months back, but my recent stay was very notable. We had an issue with our room, i will not go into the issue details as it is unimportant compared to the resolution. The staff took responsibility without defense and corrected the issue to my full satisfaction. This is UNHEARD of in this day and age. Furthermore i left my travel bag in the hotel lobby, while at the airport I remembered where I left it. I called the hotel, they had the bag and sent it via fedex to me next day, with all the contents in place. Again, UNHEARD of. You can read other positive reviews here regarding the proximity of the location and the wonderful amenities, no need for me to repeat. If that is not enough, then please consider what a wonderful staff and management the hotel has. I would recommend this property to anyone for that alone! Special mention to Bob, Victor and Elizabeth at the front desk and John Spears for understanding true customer service. Enjoy all of San Francisco from the Drisco!

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Vieques10
Reviews.Content: We arrived late (around 2am) from a miserable flight, to find this lovely, stylish hotel! Check in was a breeze, and we went to our room to discover lightly playing classical music, robes and yummy cookies laid out, and a bottle of champagne and a card from staff! We had mentioned it was an anniversary trip, but hadn't expected this! the service is wonderful, the staff is very knowlegdeable and friendly. Breakfast is tasty & plentiful for a continental type buffet, but get there early to get the best selection! Afternoon tea and cookies, or the wine reception in the early evening make a great break from a day of activity in the city. Nice location in swanky Pacific Heights, but you have to be willing to walk a bit & do public transit (you can even get Muni passes at the front desk!). Loved the Hotel Drisco! True class and style.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough good things!”
Reviews.Author: phytowoman
Reviews.Content: Awesome place, what a treat to spend your time and money in such a top notch establishment. Out of the way but worth the effort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: KarenGr
Reviews.Content: The best freshly squeezed orange juice, magnificent location, character and charm, ever attentive staff, delightfully quiet in a beautiful location. What more could you want? Nothing. There is no other place we'd stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Quiet and Dignified Location”
Reviews.Author: nlpNorthernNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my adult daughter the day before our trip north to the wine country, and again, a few days later, on the night before we were to fly back home. We arrived in SF very late, and when I made our reservation, I was told the hotel car could come pick us up. That was a huge relief, as we knew we would be very tired flying from the east coast and arriving past 1:30 am our time. The driver came promptly, and we were delighted with our room and the view! We had room 208, which the staff gave us as a free upgrade. It was a very large suite, with the living room and bedroom connected with an open archway. It was very nicely appointed with comfortable pillows and high-grade sheeting. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful! Hard cooked eggs, hot fresh (not instant) oatmeal, lots of pastries and bagels, a huge assortment of jams and other spreads (nutella, etc.) and meats as well as cheeses. I especially loved the local granola, which I had with yogurt (again, a nice selection-goat, cow, with and without fruit) and additional dried fruits. You can serve yourself their robust coffee, or order an espresso or cappuccino. The location of our room (208-both nights) had a vast view overlooking the city, because the hotel sits at the top of the hill. This location is a huge plus. Not only is it quiet, but within a stones throw are some of the most beautiful and extravagant homes you will ever see! Be sure to walk one block north to Broadway, and take in all these residences. Find the one with the outside goldfish bowl and tiered waterfalls....(the owner informed us as we were taking photos there are more pools with fish along the steps up to the front door) then continue west to the end of the block, where the steeply tiered steps (and there are many...as well as lots of athletes doing their runs up and down them) lead you along the mature stand of Eucalyptus trees in the park within the Presidio. It was a short walk for us to the Palace of Fine Arts Theater, which is not to be missed. It is immense, surprisingly so, and has an old-world sophistication to it.

Reviews.Title: “Relish the quiet side”
Reviews.Author: thrall
Reviews.Content: The Drisco is located almost at the crest of one of the high hills of the city, a couple of blocks from the Presidio Park, in a quiet residential neighborhood with fabulous views down many of the streets. It is a welcome escape from the usual frenetic hotel districts in SF. The Drisco is pleasantly dignified but not stuffy, attentive but not stifling, elegant but not fussy. The building is from 1903, and the rooms vary substantially in their layout and orientation, so if you want a view or something specific, call and ask. The included breakfast is not hot, but they offer a nice spread of yummy pastries, meats, etc. Internet is also included. On weekends, parking is a snap and free on the streets. During the week, the streets have a 3-hour limit, but the staff do what they can to provide advice to work around this. Many fine neighborhood restaurants are a moderate walk from the hotel, but note well that if walking up steep hills is difficult for you, prepare to take taxis! It's been a while since we've stayed in a hotel we enjoyed more than the little Drisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and good facilities”
Reviews.Author: jtooley
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights and 3 days over Labor Day weekend. We loved the location since it was off the beaten path in the city. We were able to run and hike in the Presidio in the morning, by walking 5 minutes to the park from the hotel. The walk down Lyon St was a treat, and were able to walk to Union St and Filbert street in 15-20minutes. The hotel had a nice selection of DVDs to borrow (recommend "Pacific Heights"). The breakfast was good. Parking was easy.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Idaho99
Reviews.Content: We nearly didn't book here after one bad review, we're so pleased we did! Its a gorgeous hotel, boutique and charming. The staff are fantastic, friendly and accommodating. We asked for a quiet room and got it, although I can't see why it would be anything else. Its such a lovely quiet area, the hotel is beautifully positioned on top of a hill. The rooms are lovely, clean, spacious and well furnished. The complimentary breakfast is a huge array of yum continental goodies, you are spoilt for choice! The allow dogs here too which we thought was amazing, very european. The beds are big and comfortable with a selection of pillows available to suit you. We really enjoyed our stay here and would love to be here longer! The only thing to watch out here is booking taxis need to be done in advance, they are often late. The hotel does offer a free chaffeur service into town though which is incredible. Thanks Drisco!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in San Francisco. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: GaryRanson
Reviews.Content: A wonderful European styled boutique hotel with first class service and staff. Beautiful neighbourhood and wonderful views.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place - intimate but not overbearing!”
Reviews.Author: susannemadden
Reviews.Content: We had a quaint but spacious room, the evening wine and cheese was so pleasant, and the breakfast was absolutely terrific. Great walking neighborhood and terrific views too. All in all a super place and we will be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Secondhandgirl
Reviews.Content: Read about this hotel and reviews just aren't good enough! It is a real gem and a great value for the city. Staff was beyond cordial and we truly felt as if they were indeed happy to have us as their guests. Due to Hurricane Irene we had to shorten trip by 1 night thus cancelling a long standing reservation. This too was met without a problem or additional charge. They all were concerned that we simply returned home safely. We will plan another trip to San Francisco soon, just to stay here again!!! Congratulations to all for your outstanding efforts!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and view, great Staff, Service food & drink! Better than we anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: Laura22_11
Reviews.Content: We have a daughter who attends USF so this was a perfect location for us. We love getting a local feel for the area such as restaurants, parks, etc. The staff at Hotel Drisco was very helpful, gave us tips on restaurants, walks, things to do in the area, that were just perfect for my husband and me. We experienced new neighborhoods that we loved! What a fabulous five days! Of course, we will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “A "Joie"ous Time at the Hotel Drisco”
Reviews.Author: Explrjunkie
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel in such a lovely neighborhood! The Hotel Drisco is located in the Pacific Heights section of San Francisco, so it is NOT near touristy destinations-you'll either need a car or be prepared for some serious walking/cab/bus fare! However, what this hotel lacks in proximity to tourist destinations, it more than makes up for in its incredible charm (a lovingly restored home that blends in beautifully with the surrounding neighborhood), wonderful hospitality (we loved getting to know Julio and so enjoyed our evening chats) and incredible amenities (big soaking tubs, AMAZINGINGLY yummy and filling breakfasts, a wine and cheese reception every evening, and the most divine chocolate biscuits at bedtime!). This is the type of hotel to stay at when you need to decompress or want a romantic getaway; if you need to be "in the center of the action', this is NOT the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Grateful guests”
Reviews.Author: infrequentraveler39
Reviews.Content: Immaculate room with gorgeous views of the city, thoughtful and gracious service. Location ideal. Quiet, serene, lovely breakfast. We are enormously appreciative.

Reviews.Title: “Civilized San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: AlecWalker
Reviews.Content: Our suite, with its moldings, arches and view of a cityscape with fog rolling, in reminded me of my aunt's similarly situated apartment in the City. This hotel is the old, formal San Francisco, with its soft California acceptance of all comers.

Reviews.Title: “PICTURE PERFECT IN PACIFIC HEIGHTS”
Reviews.Author: Salvatore77_11
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful old hotel, exceptional value for the area. well appointed large rooms, some views of the city. The staff is extremely helpfull and cater to all your needs. The breakfast(which is include in the price) is exceptional, the frexh fruit and cappicino are the best.

Reviews.Title: “Sometimes You Get It Right”
Reviews.Author: Pablo2050
Reviews.Content: We had three rooms - 7 people - and to a man (and woman) we all loved this place. It is well located right on the peak of Pacific Heights, the rooms were good, you can go for a walk, you can be down town in about 10 minutes by car (an hour or less walking), the staff were excellent and they will arrange a car for you (ask for August) at a reasonable price if you want to go out in the evening, go to the airport or whatever. The breakfast was good. We went to the wine tasting once it was okay... Enough said - good value for money and all of us would go back...

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Fit”
Reviews.Author: Omi1946
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Drisco Hotel since our daughter moved to San Francisco several years ago. We are always met with warmth, friendliness, and professionalism from the staff. The location is ideal as our family is within walking distance as are many highlights of the city. The rooms have all of the amenities that we look for in a hotel and they are immaculate and well serviced. The breakfast that is included in the room rate is delicious with French pastries, gourmet coffees, and so much more. We wholeheartedly recommend The Drisco as an ideal spot to stay in a beautiful residential neighborhood when visiting San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and homey”
Reviews.Author: savann8h
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Drisco in the beautiful Pacific Heights area. I travel to San Francisco about 4-5 times a year and work in SOMA. The complimentary car service and gourmet continental breakfast buffet were great extras. The hotel has a classic and elegant style, but it is very homey and comfortable like an inn. The staff are very friendly and make you feel very much at home. This was also a great plus when traveling alone for business. They have delicious hot panini sandwiches available, a complimentary DVD collection and a 24 hour tea/coffee area in the sitting rooms. The area is very upscale residential and the views are gorgeous. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone traveling for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: richc1983
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights, August 2-4th 2011, as the first stop on our honeymoon. This is not a downtown San Franscisco hotel, its in Pacific heights, an almost central suburb, which is about 45 minute walk from Fisherman's Wharf, or 5-10 minutes in a taxi. It is a nice 10 minute walk to Union Street which has loads of nice bars, and boutique shops. The hotel also provides a free limo service in the week, if you ask. They'll also call you a cab which get there within 5 minutes. It is a beautiful building in a nice quiet area. Our standard room was a good size, very comfortable bed and had everything you could possibly need right down to a comfy robe and slippers. Ice, biscuits and tomorrows weather forecast were put in the room when it was turned down, and all the staff were lovely. The breakfast is billed as gourmet, and it is! Any pastry you can think of, meats, boiled eggs, yoghurts, fresh juices and fruit. A fantastic place to stay. They didn't know it was our honeymoon but treated us like it was anyway! Thanks Hotel Drisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel. Best not to bring car.”
Reviews.Author: Veggievet
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family vacation and had a great time. The hotel was clean and the staff was exceptionally accommodating. The rooms were old but clean although the carpeting looked like it had seen better days. Usually I prefer newer hotels but they kept it clean so it met my requirements. The amenities were great, the breakfasts were satisfying and the cheese and wine every night was an added bonus. The 24 hour coffee and hot tea was another plus. The location was fine for us. We walked almost everywhere but we don't mind walking several miles for dinner or access to restaurants. Our only complaint, there is no parking and although they offer on weekdays to move your car every 3 hours, it's not ideal. Our recommendation is to use public transportation or walk.

Reviews.Title: “best location and best hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jlyslo
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place. The staff are incredibly friendly, the location is supreme, and the rooms are as comfortable as any 5 star hotel. I read some comments that there may be rooms that are poorly located, but not ours or our friends'. Great breakfast and wine tasting as well. The perfect vacation hotel (and for me business as well) away from the touristy hubs but close enough to get anywhere in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Classy n quiet”
Reviews.Author: cyberbliss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and were mighty impressed. Bed was comfy, room a reasonable size, bathroom facilities good. Oh and it was very quiet. The quality of the wine and cheese (at the evening reception) was pretty decent - much better than the other Joie de Vivre hotel in SF. Staff were helpful and friendly. Probably the thing to be most aware of when staying at this hotel is its location - it isn't that close to many of the touristy parts of SF and it is near the top of one of the many many steep climbs that we came to love...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and super comfy”
Reviews.Author: travel4ever08
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and Recommend it to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: mat031
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. The rooms was very attractive with a nice view of the city. Parking was a question, but we always were able to find a spot. Very nice location, but really too far to walk downtown. Parking anywhere near fisherman's wharf is a problem, take a cab from the hotel to the downtown area

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: Deanshannont
Reviews.Content: My new bride booked this for the first 2 nights of our honeymoon prior to driving up to napa. The reviews were good but the price seemed low so I wasnt expecting much. What a surprise. The hotel is beautiful. We love older buildings with character but at the Drisco old doesn't mean run down. The rooms are all updated with modern fixtures butvstill have that old world charm. As for service, I can tell you I travel over 60 nights a year and the staff at the Drisco rival hotels that I've paid 4 times the rate at. My wife hushed me when I said " they should charge more" We will return again next year and the Drisco is where we will stay. No question. Highlights. Charming. Subtle. Romantic. Clean. Impeccable kind service. Close to wharf and gg bridge. Facts. You hear more than in newer hotels (never annoying though) if travellimh with heavy bags get some help from front desk as the entrance has a stairs but there is a cute elevator in the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in San Francisco with European charm”
Reviews.Author: liviuklein
Reviews.Content: One of the best location in the city, Pacific Heights, hidden between old money mansions and amazing views of the city and the bay, the Drisco is truly an European hotel. Building has old charm, but rooms are modern, with state of the art amenities (flat screen TV, DVD, CD, free wifi throughout), extremely well maintained, and with a killer breakfast (not to mention the afternoon free wine and cheese reception!). The prices are well below similar quality high end hotels such as th Ritz or Four Seasons. I have stayed in a lot of hotels in San Francisco over the years, buy after discovering the Drisco. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay in Pacific Heights”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Drisco for three nights in July 2011. The hotel is in a prime Pacific Heights location, the rooms are well appointed, the staff is very professional and friendly, and the breakfast was excellent. The reason for our stay is that we were moving from the neighborhood, and we needed to stay in a hotel near our home during our move. Regardless if you are moving, in town for business, or on vacation in the city, I would highly recommend this hotel -- you will enjoy your stay in this prime location of the city!

Reviews.Title: “A Divine Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: conwaycom2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, and were charmed and awed by all it had to offer. This hotel is located in a beautiful and quiet residential neighborhood. At first, we were concerned about possible parking issues, but were assured this wouldn't be an problem. It wasn't! We never had one problem finding a parking spot and were told, if a problem occurred, they would help us find one. One of the employees even offered his own personal parking spot. We arrived early and decided to see if we could check in. We were met at the door by an employee, Bob, who instantly got us an available room and spent the next 20 minutes showing us the hotel, recommending places to visit, eat, what tours to take, etc. Every recommendation was awesome! Bob also told us about the wine and cheese reception every night and the breakfast they offer daily included in our stay. Our room was very clean and beautiful, overlooking the million dollar houses that surrounded us. The bed was heavenly and the bottled water and chocolate shortbread cookies they offer with their turndown service was a nice touch! The wine and cheese reception was wonderful and the general manager personally greeted everyone who attended, ensuring everyone was satisfied with their stay. The morning breakfast was no different. Breakfast included oatmeal, fresh pastries, fruit, bagels and toast with every topping imaginable, fruit juice, tea, coffee or specially made lattes, mochas, and cappuccinos. It was fabulous! Again, the general manager was there greeting all the guests. There was also a sitting room that had complimentary citrus water, coffee and tea off the front lobby. It was the personal service that was the best part of this stay. The entire staff couldn't do enough for you and everyone was always pleasant and happy to speak with. Overall, this hotel was spectacular and I highly recommend staying a couple nights. Well worth the money and reasonably priced for all it offered. Every hotel should be this divine! We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, can hear a pin drop”
Reviews.Author: JKHittinTheRoad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Drisco while attending my brother's wedding. I can see why it gets the stellar ratings it does. The service is outstanding, they bent over backwards. Clean as can be. So quiet you can hear a pin drop. Extremely low key and sophisticated in an understated way, like staying at a home in Pacific Heights. Great value for the money, especially by SF standards. If you want a great gym, a pool, access to trolley lines, surrounding restaurants, lots of excitement and bling, don't stay here. If your style is commensurate with what I've described above, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “pretty much perfection”
Reviews.Author: alex6076
Reviews.Content: lovely little boutique hotel, about 15 or 20 mins from anywhere you would want to go to in san francisco. we stayed there on our honeymoon and would definately go back. the room was idyllic, immaculate and had 100 percent all you would need. yeah the floorboards creak a wee bit and you might hear the odd door close but no big deal. the staff are completely proffessional, the room was perfect on arrival and we got a bottle of champagne on the house. free breakfast and free wine and cheese in evenings. nice fast internet . the number 3 bus to downtown is 3 mins walk away (downhill there uphill back but not difficult). fillmore street (loads of bars and restaurants) is like a ten min walk and not too hilly). the concierge (Bob) is worth his weight in gold and i recommend whatever he recommends (he did us a pretty good recommendation on the napa wine tour and also recommended the bike across the bridge instead of walking it.. again spot on!) only hotel we stayed at in san francisco but i reckon you would be hard pushed to beat it in terms of location, view, comfort and experience. very nice indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Loads of SF Charm”
Reviews.Author: bronx2LA
Reviews.Content: Perched on a hill in residential Pacific Heights, the Drisco is a small gem away from the tourist bustle. I love it because it is a converted mansion with architectural charm, very comfortably furnished with cozy chairs, reading lamps, great beds and luxury linens. The staff is warm and friendly, breakfast buffet is just right and served in a sun-filled room. Private, quiet and an easy walk to neighborhood restaurants, cafes and shopping on Fillmore.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: es2javatin
Reviews.Content: Boy, you could not ask for a better, more enjoyable, attentive place to stay. Incredibly thoughtful staff. They really go out of their way to make your stay special and welcoming. It's a good location without the hustle and bustle of being in Union Square. I can't say enough for this hotel. Thank you for a very memorable stay. P. S.: the breakfast is unbelievably amazing!!

Reviews.Title: “Got Stuck Here, But No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: MarisaS39
Reviews.Content: I missed a flight, company meeting. No worries. I got put up here, and it was like a mini-vaca. 24 hr coffee (I'm an addict), great rooms, and a bed to DIE for. All I did was decompress and watch HBO. Comfy. Cozy. With ROOM service! :-) I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A hilltop treasure.”
Reviews.Author: ellemcelle
Reviews.Content: The staff couldn't have been more helpful: they upgraded our room, called taxis, made sure we had everything we needed and were unfailingly courteous.
